intro: Pentaschistis pictigluma var. mannii, commonly known as the red-leafed strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that range from deep red to purple in color. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding visual contrast to its foliage. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden settings. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in tropical and subtropical regions.
